oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Shiloh National Military Park, "Michigan Monument"

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soldiers
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Shiloh National Military Park (Tenn. and Miss.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The "monument erected and dedicated by the people of Michigan in memory of her soldiers who fought and fell in the Battle of Shiloh." Features soldier standing with his rifle.
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: Shiloh National Military Park (Tenn. and Miss.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: L. T. McDaniel
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Monument was erected in 1912 by the State of Michigan. Inscription contains casualty listing for Michigan units that fought in the Battle of Shiloh, often referred to as the bloodiest battle of the Civil War.; National Park Service records list 13,047 Federal and 10,699 Confederate casualties.
